statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Boston U. 68, Hofstra 61
article.story: KINGSTON, R.I. -- Darryl Partin scored 25 points, including four 3-pointers, to lead Boston University in a 68-61 win over Hofstra on Sunday. D.J. Irving scored 15 points for the Terriers (2-4), including three of the game's last five points and adding a steal in the final minute of the TicketCity Legends Classic's Kingston subregional. Patrick Hazel added 11 points and grabbed 10 rebounds. The Pride led 33-31 at the break and 56-53 with just 6:11 to play when Boston put together its game-winning rally. Partin sank a pair of foul shots to spark a 10-1 Terriers run for a lead they wouldn't relinquish. Hofstra pulled back within 63-61 with 1:18 left, but Irving's layup and a foul shot sealed it for Boston. Hofstra (3-4) had just one player in double figures, as Mike Moore scored 27 points and pulled down 11 rebounds. He was 5 of 9 on 3-pointers.
